newsitem.title: ALBANIA: FIRST FOREIGNER DIES IN ALBANIAN TROUBLES.
newsitem.headline: FIRST FOREIGNER DIES IN ALBANIAN TROUBLES.

text.p: A Greek man on Wednesday became the first foreigner to be killed in Albania's current wave of violent unrest.
Engineer Jorgos Stamatis, 42, died of a bullet wound to his liver, Vlore doctor Naun Kristo said.
Stamatis died after being caught up in a fight between two of the gangs that have formed in the wake of the troubles here.
The fighting ended after the arrival on the scene of Italian and Greek soldiers of the U.N.-backed force which is protecting supplies of aid.
